##Life Saving Drug: HIV positive people donate to new Crown Infections

Gayspot

Feature Introduction, Independent magazine, focus on the existence and survival of sexual minorities.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
By Wang Dashi

Squirrel

Drop me a line at gayspot@163. Com

Squirrels are at the heart of a peer-to-peer platform for people living with HIV, which helps them take out medications that are not in use and lend them to people in need. In the early morning of January 23, the Wuhan Government issued a closure notice, starting from 10:00 am on January 23, the city bus, subway, ferry, long-distance passenger transport suspended operations, airport, railway station from the Han Channel was temporarily closed. Since the news of the closure came in the early hours of the morning, most of Wuhan's residents were still asleep, and by the time they woke up, the city had nearly come to a standstill, with people trying to make a last-ditch escape in their private cars blocking their way out of the city. That day, that is, in Wuhan, HIV INFECTED TO HIM FOR HELP: Can Not go back, can I borrow medicine?

Creutzfeldt-jakob is effective against coronaviruses

Eight years ago in Beijing squirrels, just got a university diploma at the same time, he also got the AIDS diagnosis report card.

After a brief period of frustration, he tried to reconcile with himself. After graduation, Squirrel went to Guangzhou, became a white-collar office building, daily routine life, but also gradually put down the pursuit of perfect obsession. Usually work, weekend fitness, and very punctual every three months to designated hospitals "punch in" to get their own medicine.

There are a number of drugs for AIDS, and doctors create a cocktail of drugs based on each person's condition, known as a cocktail. For eight years, for more than three, the squirrels ate cleats. As a free drug, cleats also have their own limitations, to eat twice a day do not say, some people will have diarrhea. "If the conditions are met, many patients will choose self-financed drugs with minor side effects, " he said, adding that Kleenex, an imported drug, can not be produced in China because of patent restrictions.

In 2017, the Squirrel came to Zhengzhou to live, so that he could spend more time with his family. "I'm happier than I used to be, and I'm sure I'm healthier than a lot of my peers who work out regularly, " said the open-minded mother, who knew at first that her son was infected with AIDS, as did her boyfriend. "He's negative. He doesn't mind. "

Staying away from first-tier cities is still somewhat inconvenient, such as having to wait in long lines every time to get medicine. Moreover, not everyone is always able to pick up the medicine within a certain time limit. People often miss the time for some reason, but the medicine is given according to the quota, the hospital will not give more. "after all, we can't stop for a day. We all have problems. "

He found that he was not the only one with similar problems, so he launched a campaign on a mutual help platform to help infected people take out the drugs that were temporarily idle and lend them to those in need of an emergency. "This is a very rich group, with a wide range of occupations, age groups and income levels. Everyone has their own ups and downs in life, " he said

The Squirrel is at the heart of the group. He changed his name to "HIV Squirrel Guy" and said, "nothing to be ashamed of. " He is smart, knows English, and is considerate, members of the mutual help platform have spread to more than 30 cities across the country.

The news that seals a city makes him uneasy, the express mail that packs good sends out, he can silently pray, "the hope also can receive in Wuhan. "

He told the patients, "you remember no matter what time must first take care of themselves, infected with the drug is life. "

More worrying than delivery is the growth of the disease, with no clear cure, panic gathering like clouds before a hurricane, and winter being the season of respiratory disease, the local hospitals in Wuhan are packed like Sardines as food. A series of first-line medical staff infected with new crown pneumonia, but also let the already extremely nervous medical system is on the verge of collapse.

The Wuhan Municipal Government has issued a notice requiring suspected patients with symptoms to be quarantined at home.

On January 26th the COVID-19 released a new version of its pneumonia treatment plan, in which it added the recommended dose of Lopinaveritonavir twice a day to the list of oral medications.

The news was widely retweeted. With the medicine, there's still a chance. That long list of drug names may be difficult for the average person to understand, but squirrels "have been dealing with AIDS for eight years" , for those names, he is too familiar, that is, cleats.

"thank the volunteers. "

Domestic drug companies have named Protease inhibitor tablets as a type of Niacin, which lowers the activity of the protease and thus inhibits the replication of the virus in cells, starting in 2000, lopinavetonavir is used as an antiviral therapy.

The National Institutes of Health added Kleenex to its list of new-crown-pneumonia drugs on January 26th, but for squirrels and members of the mutual aid platform, earlier news dates back to the late night of January 22nd. A micro blog post by Wang Guangfa, director of the Department of respiratory and Critical Care Medicine at Peking University First Hospital, caught their attention after he was diagnosed with new pneumonia on the 21st, with a wealth of medical experience and the spirit of "Shennong taste herbs" , Wang began self-treatment in isolation ward, he gave himself to eat is cleats.

A day later, he said on his micro-blog, "Peking University Hobo, " "after a day of treatment, I am glad to finally stop having a fever today. "

On Jan. 24, the Shanghai Municipal Clinical Center for Public Health, one of the city's designated medical facilities for patients with COVID-19 pneumonia, posted an article on its official wechat account, to list COVID-19 as a potentially effective drug.

"My first reaction is that many people may not have access to medicines, " he said. The country's free AIDS antiviral drug is centralized procurement, with independent drug supply channels, and limited to designated hospitals, not allowed to buy or sell. "unless you are infected with HIV, do not say ordinary people, even other medical staff may not know. "

In the last week of January 2020, in addition to the 1,000 new cases of pneumonia in Wuhan every day, several times the number of suspected cases were quarantined at home, and their travel became mired after the city was sealed off, buses, taxis are all suspended, once the majority of cases can only walk to the hospital.

At the end of the month, media reported that a 17-year-old cerebral palsy patient was starved to death in his home because his family had been quarantined. Some of the patients who saw the news began to voice their opinions online, "all three of us are infected. Please help us. " Similar appeals flooded Squirrel's Weibo Account, and he realized that he "had to do something. "

"The average hospital or pharmacy doesn't have any, its circulation is so bad that most people can't get it, " said one member of the platform. "Should we donate our unused drugs to people in need? "

HIV infected people can receive up to three months of medication at a time, may be due to personal reasons, the hands of a month or two of extra medicine, donated unused drugs become possible. As for the quality of drugs can be assured, domestic first-line AIDS drugs including Kleenex are free, there is no profit space.

The Squirrel thought long and hard about how to donate drugs. "Not all doctors have a prescription for cleats, and hospitals can't deliver the drugs they receive directly to patients. "

After consulting with legal volunteers, the Squirrel decided to donate medicine directly to individuals with NCP, "since state-provided AIDS drugs are free of charge, we took full account of the legal risks when we started the operation, and it is not illegal for people to voluntarily donate or temporarily borrow drugs. "

Starting on January 28, Squirrel began to launch an initiative through its own platform, calling on people living with HIV to donate their unused Kleenex to new patients with coronary pneumonia, the condition is "the patient provides the medical certificate, the case confirmed diagnosis report or the prescription" .

At approximately 8:30 p.m. on the 28th, the first new crown patient contacted squirrel. The other is a third-class hospital in Wuhan doctors. He sent over the doctor's note and the test results. The next day, 30 people registered with the Squirrel for help. "That's when things started to get busy, " he says. He organizes volunteers in support groups, some for audits, some for drugs, and himself as a middleman.

Since January 29, squirrels have been receiving bottles, bottles and bottles of Kleenex from all over the country, with the farthest being an AIDS sufferer from Taiwan, who donated five bottles at a time. During those days he had to deal with more than thirty packages by himself. "He had little time to sleep. "

He's GonNa have to repackage the medicine he received. He calculated: "according to the Health Commission to the program, the amount of a person is 14 days, twice a day, once two tablets, a bottle of the original domestic factory of Kleenex for two new crown patients. "

Got The medicine, new difficulties in front of the Squirrel, how to send. Due to the traffic stoppage in Wuhan, the first medicine was sent on the 23rd, and the addressee had to go to the branch office to pick it up. He found the only SF express still open.

Express delivery "shakes his head when it sounds like it's going to Wuhan. " He said frankly that the current transportation capacity is tight. In normal days, all the business assigned to various express delivery companies flocked to a company in Shunfeng. Only disaster relief materials would be sent to Wuhan. He immediately contacted Shunfeng's customer service, communicate the delivery of the drugs to the back office. "then they agreed to deliver the goods in the name of relief supplies. "

Another difficulty is getting the drugs to the people who need them, especially those who are still under medical quarantine.

At this time, the spider appeared, his micro-blog called "spider monkey bread. ". "I didn't know he was a vlog blogger, or that he had so many fans. " spiders like to hike and shoot videos, and after the city was closed he started filming "the diary of Wuhan's closing. ".

The spider did not immediately respond to the Squirrel's request. "This is a prudent thing, HIV is different from the new coronavirus, can the drug be used universally, is this drug legal? " But after getting up the next day, he promised the squirrel, because the squirrel gave him a list of doctors from the Wuhan Sanjia Hospital, there's more than one doctor, and one in four health care workers on the list of people who apply for drugs from squirrels.

On the morning of February 1, the first batch of medicines for eight people arrived at his home in Mitsutani, where he drove from Wuchang, through Hankou, and then on to Hanyang. Along the way, the doors of roadside shops are closed, stray animals wander the streets, and the smoke of disinfectant, a real-life version of Chernobyl.

He made a Vlog of his daily drug deliveries, and when he was warned not to get too close to his patients, he put them in a designated spot and waited for them to pick them up from afar.

The volunteers on the support platform were divided into two groups, one to vet patients who applied for drugs, the other to raise drugs, and the squirrel to act as a transit point. At that time may be a day to send 20 to 30 packages, "if there is no online and offline volunteer assistance, I simply can not do it alone, to thank the volunteers. "

"I just want us all to live. "

Because Domestic AIDS patients take Keli Chi is not much, less than two days to the domestic aids drug collection, after all, is from the AIDS patients of idle drugs, can not have too much surplus. But the list of drug applicants is in the 80s, so we need to find a way to get new drugs. He turned his attention to India. Demand from India, also a populous country, has been strong for antiviral drug.

After asking a friend to raise more than 300 boxes of Kleenex from India, the squirrel went back to Weibo to post a message, looking for someone to take the medicine back home. A group of hikers who were planning to return from India helped, bringing back a batch in advance. But access was cut off immediately, and as the outbreak grew worse, countries shut down direct flights to mainland Chinese cities. He set his sights on Hong Kong, which at the time had no restricted flights.

On February 7, the first shipment of Kleenex from India arrived in Hong Kong, and trouble ensued. Hong Kong announced that it would be closed from February 3, but a charity called the hope group helped squirrel, "They were also supplying drugs to infected health care workers. " The team helped the squirrel manually bring back more than 100 doses of the drug, and shipping in Hong Kong was then halted.

On February 9th, squirrels finally got their hands on the first batch of Indian versions of Kleenex.

As soon as a new friend request is made, the Squirrel sends it immediately, "address, credentials, avoid a panic description. " The information submitted by the other person is then passed on to the volunteer in charge of the review.

He said about a quarter of the patients who first approached him were infected health care workers. The average patient can only get one dose, but for the medical staff, the squirrel can give up to two doses so they can share them with other infected colleagues.

In the view of some, treating patients with antiviral drug pneumonia without rigorous medical validation carries medical and ethical risks. The question "No side effects? " came up most often, and others countered, "side effects or survival. which do you prefer? "

Squirrels also know that there are individual patients even get the drug do not dare to eat, "especially they know that this drug is the treatment of AIDS after. "

As for the effectiveness of Klebsiella in the treatment of new coronary pneumonia, "I have not specifically calculated, overall 70% is yes, mainly early mild patients. "

The person that finds a squirrel to hold try to see at first mindset, come to seek help of new crown pneumonia patient majority is cornered, "hear useful" . More patients are being cured, and more people are turning to help. "Then some people applied but couldn't get the medicine, went backstage and reported it, and my wechat was blocked. "

"The attacks on me have not stopped. " He said, for example, that some people spread rumors on the Internet that the medicine offered was to be bought out of pocket. At that time, some unscrupulous traders did peddle cleats on the Internet, at one point, it was $4,000 a bottle. The angry Squirrel confronted the rumormonger. "I don't care where you heard it. If you know anything about the rumormonger, please tell me. I will go to court. "

But these helpless encounter was finally taken by him, "just hope we all survive together, life is very precious. ".

The first batch of Indian medicine arrived only slightly to alleviate the shortage, "more than two hundred and twenty copies were sent out, " the squirrel once again turned to his Indian friend for help.

The drug was supposed to arrive in the country on February 10, but this time it was seized by customs. "The customs officials said they needed a drug import permit before they could let me go. At present, I have to go to the hospital of the donor unit, then take the receiving materials from the hospital and go to the Provincial Drug Administration Bureau to get a drug import permit before they can let me go. "

Rules are rules, and even though customs officials know that squirrels deliver life-saving drugs, over 300 of them pass through at once, "I actually understand them, and they've given me a lot of ideas. ". The problem ended up being stuck with Indian drugmakers, "who are too slow to process documents. "

He has raised as much as he can from people living with HIV, fearing that "it will not be long before we run out of drugs, and it will be hard to get them before the full power of the factory is produced. " Indian drugs appear to be the last hope, but whether the drugs will make it to Wuhan remains to be seen. He changed his signature to, "don't ask me for cleats again. ".

They're infected

When mutual aid began in 2017, many infected people turned to squirrels for help, some with drugs, some with life. "Some people will change their direction because of this [ HIV ] status change, because of the escape. " This new pneumonia patients, will have a similar feeling, "They're afraid they're going to infect other people, and they're afraid they're not going to get help, " he said. As he was when he launched the platform, "we want to really help people on this level. "

On Feb. 19, Squirrel received another batch of online donations of 100 boxes of 60 tablets of Kleenex, meaning at least 150 people had access to the drug. But the rate of improvement of the epidemic has exceeded public expectations, especially in late February, when new cases outside Hubei Province have returned to zero.

"Now that the drugs are being donated at the contact hospital, we will continue to return to drug assistance for people with HIV once the rest of the work is completed, " he said, feeling a sense of relief.

This time he set himself a goal of 500 people to help new patients with pneumonia. "All the costs of going to India to raise drugs are crowdfunded by volunteers from our platform, " he said. Unified Action, from donation to distribution, brings participants closer together. And because of this rescue, change is happening, and while there are some misunderstandings, the divisions between the different communities are breaking down.

Two volunteers with a medical background contacted the Squirrel Online and joined his review team. "They're not HIV positive. We don't talk about whether you're HIV positive. " Among the drugs donated later, no longer all HIV positive, some ordinary people who can buy drugs overseas are also donating to him.

"I can't decide what other people think of me, but I can decide how I treat others. " When Squirrel tweeted, he hoped to change the public's prejudice against the AIDS community through his actions. "If we can change the image and recognition of this group, of course. If we can't, we won't push for it. We don't really think about our image and reputation. We just want to save someone and do our part. "

For the future, whether it's people with AIDS, people with new Crown Infections, or people facing a potential epidemic, squirrels say, "Pessimism and fear are not helpful. Of course, discrimination is the worst thing you can do. All you have to do is block out the negative information and do your job. "

Copyrighted articles and images

All Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS
